dict.string: When does the GDPR go into effect?
Which of the following does the GDPR apply to?
Any organisation anywhere in the world that provides services into the EU that involve processing the data of EU citizens.
Only organisations within the EU that provide services into the EU that involve processing the data of EU citizens.
The processing of data by the direction of law enforcement, national security, or activities carried out by individuals purely for personal/household purposes.
Any organisation anywhere in the world that provides services into the EU that involve processing the data of EU citizens.
What could happen if a business does not comply with the GDPR?
Fines of up to 20 million euros.
Four percent of annual global turnover.
Which of the following data is prohibited under the GDPR?
Which of the following is considered personal data?
What must you do if you offer an ‘information society service’ to children?
Ensure that you obtain consent from the parent or guardian.
Which of the following is not true about the right to be informed?
You can charge up to 5 euros to individuals who request information about processing personal data.
The information about processing personal data must be concise.
You can charge up to 5 euros to individuals who request information about processing personal data.
Once an individual has requested access to her data, it must be provided within this amount of time.
This gives the individual the right to remove his/her personal data from an organisation.
This means individuals can obtain and reuse their data for their own purposes.
